blocks.name: cpfx
blocks.content: Syntax for the prefix operator.
blocks.origin: const class cpfx { prefix }

blocks.name: diff.cpfx.s
diff.cpfx.c
diff.cpfx.w
df-pfx
blocks.content: Define an operation which extracts prefixes of words, i.e. subwords (or substrings) starting at the beginning of a word (or string). In other words, ` ( S prefix L ) ` is the prefix of the word ` S ` of length ` L ` . Definition in Section 9.1 of [AhoHopUll] p. 318. See also Wikipedia "Substring" ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Substring#Prefix . (Contributed by AV, 2-May-2020.)

blocks.name: pfxnndmnd
blocks.content: The value of a prefix operation for out-of-domain arguments. (This is due to our definition of function values for out-of-domain arguments, see ~ ndmfv ). (Contributed by AV, 3-Dec-2022.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm pfxval(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  ovmpt2d(hs0, hs1, c0, cpfx, c2, co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c2)), universe, cn0, co(cv(hs0), csubstr, cop(nat0, cv(hs1))), universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wceq(cpfx, cmpo(hs0, hs1, universe, cn0, co(cv(hs0), csubstr, cop(nat0, cv(hs1))))))
  df-pfx(hs0, hs1)
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), csubstr, cop(nat0, cv(hs1))), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c2))))
  oveq12d(cv(hs0), csubstr, cop(nat0, cv(hs1)), c0, cop(nat0, c2), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  adantl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cop(nat0, cv(hs1)), cop(nat0, c2)))
  opeq2(cv(hs1), c2, nat0)
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0))
  ovexd(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c2), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c2)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c2)))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  diff.hs1.w(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
}

thm pfxcl(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

} = {
  pm2.61ne(co(c0, cpfx, c2), emptycls, wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(co(c0, cpfx, c2), cword(c1)), wcel(emptycls, cword(c1)))
  eleq1(co(c0, cpfx, c2), emptycls, cword(c1))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wne(co(c0, cpfx, c2), emptycls), wcel(co(c0, cpfx, c2), cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cn0))
  sylbi(wne(co(c0, cpfx, c2), emptycls), wcel(c2, cn0), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cpfx, c2))))
  n0(hs0, co(c0, cpfx, c2))
  exlimiv(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cpfx, c2)), wcel(c2, cn0))
  elmpt2cl2(hs1, hs2, cv(hs0), c0, cpfx, c2, cn0, universe, co(cv(hs1), csubstr, cop(nat0, cv(hs2))))
  df-pfx(hs1, hs2)
  eqeltrd(co(c0, cpfx, c2), cword(c1), co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  pfxval(c0, cword(c1), c2)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cn0), wcel(co(c0, csubstr, cop(nat0, c2)), cword(c1)))
  swrdcl(c0, c1, nat0, c2)
  a1i(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(emptycls, cword(c1)))
  wrd0(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cpfx, c2))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c2, cn0))
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.c(cn0)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs2.c(cn0)
  diff.hs2.c(universe)
}

blocks.name: disjwrdpfx
blocks.content: Sets of words are disjoint if each set contains exactly the extensions of distinct words of a fixed length. Remark: A word ` W ` is called an "extension" of a word ` P ` if ` P ` is a prefix of ` W ` . (Contributed by AV, 29-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 6-May-2020.)

blocks.name: ccatpfx
blocks.content: Concatenating a prefix with an adjacent subword makes a longer prefix. (Contributed by AV, 7-May-2020.)
